page.title: 18ECOLOGY - Stream Life
page.content: A number of small streams run through the area. The most popular with people from the town runs from Dalton Piercy past Brierton Farms. The stream is fairly small although it can become quite swollen with rain. The best viewpoints are close to Dalton, at the Brierton bridge and beside Owton Grange. Newts can be seen frequently, especially the common newt, and another species which is known locally as a 'salamander'. Newts can also be found in Brierton quarry. The streams also contain frogs as well as a number of small fish. The stickleback is fairly common, together with another fish locally known as a 'catfish'. Grass snakes have been seen beside the stream but they are fairly rare.
